00019 /*! \file
00020  * \brief Configuration File Parser

00022 
00023 #ifndef _ASTERISK_CONFIG_H
00024 #define _ASTERISK_CONFIG_H

00026 #if defined(__cplusplus) || defined(c_plusplus)
00027 extern "C" {
00028 #endif
00029 
00030 #include <stdarg.h>
00031 
00032 struct ast_config;
00033 
00034 struct ast_category;
00035 
00036 /*! \brief Structure for variables, used for configurations and for channel variables 
00037 */
00038 struct ast_variable {
00039    char *name;
00040    char *value;
00041    int lineno;
00042    int object;    /*!< 0 for variable, 1 for object */
00043    int blanklines;   /*!< Number of blanklines following entry */
00044    struct ast_comment *precomments;
00045    struct ast_comment *sameline;
00046    struct ast_variable *next;
00047    char stuff[0];
00048 };
00049 
00050 typedef struct ast_config *config_load_func(const char *database, const char *table, const char *configfile, struct ast_config *config, int withcomments);
00051 typedef struct ast_variable *realtime_var_get(const char *database, const char *table, va_list ap);
00052 typedef struct ast_config *realtime_multi_get(const char *database, const char *table, va_list ap);
00053 typedef int realtime_update(const char *database, const char *table, const char *keyfield, const char *entity, va_list ap);
00054 typedef int realtime_store(const char *database, const char *table, va_list ap);
00055 typedef int realtime_destroy(const char *database, const char *table, const char *keyfield, const char *entity, va_list ap);
00056 
00057 /*! \brief Configuration engine structure, used to define realtime drivers */
00058 struct ast_config_engine {
00059    char *name;
00060    config_load_func *load_func;
00061    realtime_var_get *realtime_func;
00062    realtime_multi_get *realtime_multi_func;
00063    realtime_update *update_func;
00064    realtime_store *store_func;
00065    realtime_destroy *destroy_func;
00066    struct ast_config_engine *next;
00067 };
00068 
00069 /*! \brief Load a config file 
00070  * \param filename path of file to open.  If no preceding '/' character, path is considered relative to AST_CONFIG_DIR
00071  * Create a config structure from a given configuration file.
00072  *
00073  * Returns NULL on error, or an ast_config data structure on success
00074  */
00075 struct ast_config *ast_config_load(const char *filename);
00076 struct ast_config *ast_config_load_with_comments(const char *filename);
00077 
00078 /*! \brief Destroys a config 
00079  * \param config pointer to config data structure
00080  * Free memory associated with a given config
00081  *
00082  */
00083 void ast_config_destroy(struct ast_config *config);
00084 
00085 /*! \brief Goes through categories 
00086  * \param config Which config structure you wish to "browse"
00087  * \param prev A pointer to a previous category.
00088  * This funtion is kind of non-intuitive in it's use.  To begin, one passes NULL as the second arguement.  It will return a pointer to the string of the first category in the file.  From here on after, one must then pass the previous usage's return value as the second pointer, and it will return a pointer to the category name afterwards.
00089  *
00090  * Returns a category on success, or NULL on failure/no-more-categories
00091  */
00092 char *ast_category_browse(struct ast_config *config, const char *prev);
00093 
00094 /*! \brief Goes through variables
00095  * Somewhat similar in intent as the ast_category_browse.
00096  * List variables of config file category
00097  *
00098  * Returns ast_variable list on success, or NULL on failure
00099  */
00100 struct ast_variable *ast_variable_browse(const struct ast_config *config, const char *category);
00101 
00102 /*! \brief Gets a variable 
00103  * \param config which (opened) config to use
00104  * \param category category under which the variable lies
00105  * \param variable which variable you wish to get the data for
00106  * Goes through a given config file in the given category and searches for the given variable
00107  *
00108  * Returns the variable value on success, or NULL if unable to find it.
00109  */
00110 const char *ast_variable_retrieve(const struct ast_config *config, const char *category, const char *variable);
00111 
00112 /*! \brief Retrieve a category if it exists
00113  * \param config which config to use
00114  * \param category_name name of the category you're looking for
00115  * This will search through the categories within a given config file for a match.
00116  *
00117  * Returns pointer to category if found, NULL if not.
00118  */
00119 struct ast_category *ast_category_get(const struct ast_config *config, const char *category_name);
00120 
00121 /*! \brief Check for category duplicates 
00122  * \param config which config to use
00123  * \param category_name name of the category you're looking for
00124  * This will search through the categories within a given config file for a match.
00125  *
00126  * Return non-zero if found
00127  */
00128 int ast_category_exist(const struct ast_config *config, const char *category_name);
00129 
00130 /*! \brief Retrieve realtime configuration 
00131  * \param family which family/config to lookup
00132  * This will use builtin configuration backends to look up a particular 
00133  * entity in realtime and return a variable list of its parameters.  Note
00134  * that unlike the variables in ast_config, the resulting list of variables
00135  * MUST be freed with ast_variables_destroy() as there is no container.
00136  */
00137 struct ast_variable *ast_load_realtime(const char *family, ...);
00138 struct ast_variable *ast_load_realtime_all(const char *family, ...);
00139 
00140 /*! \brief Retrieve realtime configuration 
00141  * \param family which family/config to lookup
00142  * This will use builtin configuration backends to look up a particular 
00143  * entity in realtime and return a variable list of its parameters. Unlike
00144  * the ast_load_realtime, this function can return more than one entry and
00145  * is thus stored inside a taditional ast_config structure rather than 
00146  * just returning a linked list of variables.
00147  */
00148 struct ast_config *ast_load_realtime_multientry(const char *family, ...);
00149 
00150 /*! \brief Update realtime configuration 
00151  * \param family which family/config to be updated
00152  * \param keyfield which field to use as the key
00153  * \param lookup which value to look for in the key field to match the entry.
00154  * This function is used to update a parameter in realtime configuration space.
00155  *
00156  */
00157 int ast_update_realtime(const char *family, const char *keyfield, const char *lookup, ...);
00158 
00159 /*! \brief Create realtime configuration 
00160  * \param family which family/config to be created
00161  * This function is used to create a parameter in realtime configuration space.
00162  *
00163  */
00164 int ast_store_realtime(const char *family, ...);
00165 
00166 /*! \brief Destroy realtime configuration 
00167  * \param family which family/config to be destroyed
00168  * \param keyfield which field to use as the key
00169  * \param lookup which value to look for in the key field to match the entry.
00170  * This function is used to destroy an entry in realtime configuration space.
00171  * Additional params are used as keys.
00172  *
00173  */
00174 int ast_destroy_realtime(const char *family, const char *keyfield, const char *lookup, ...);
00175 
00176 /*! \brief Check if realtime engine is configured for family 
00177  * returns 1 if family is configured in realtime and engine exists
00178  * \param family which family/config to be checked
00179 */
00180 int ast_check_realtime(const char *family);
00181 
00182 /*! \brief Check if there's any realtime engines loaded */
00183 int ast_realtime_enabled(void);
00184 
00185 /*! \brief Free variable list 
00186  * \param var the linked list of variables to free
00187  * This function frees a list of variables.
00188  */
00189 void ast_variables_destroy(struct ast_variable *var);

00192 int ast_config_engine_register(struct ast_config_engine *newconfig);

00195 int ast_config_engine_deregister(struct ast_config_engine *del);
